intro: Satureja brevicalyx, commonly known as narrow-leaved savory, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its aromatic, small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its essential oils contain compounds like thymol and carvacrol, which contribute to its strong, spicy scent. Satureja brevicalyx is often used in traditional herbal medicine and as a culinary herb.
